user.title: Area Occupancy Detection
user.description: Select an area to manage or choose an action. At least one area must be configured before finishing setup.

menu_option_descriptions.add_area: Configure a new room or zone for occupancy detection
menu_option_descriptions.manage_areas: Edit or remove previously configured areas
menu_option_descriptions.finish_setup: Save configuration and create the integration

data_description.selected_option: Choose an area to edit or remove, add a new area, or finish setup

manage_areas.title: Manage Areas
manage_areas.description: Select an area to edit or remove.

area_action.title: Manage Area
area_action.description: Choose an action for this area.

area_config.title: {mode} Area: {area_name}
area_config.description: Configure sensors and parameters for this area.

data_description.area_id: Select the Home Assistant area for this occupancy detection. The area name will be automatically used for the device and entities.
data_description.purpose: The primary purpose of this area determines decay behavior. Different purposes have different half-life values that affect how quickly occupancy probability decreases over time.
data_description.name: This is the name of the area or detection area. It will be used to name the sensors and the area occupancy entity.

data_description.motion_sensors: These will be used to detect occupancy and presence. They can be motion sensors, occupancy sensors, or presence sensors.
data_description.weight_motion: The weight given to motion sensor inputs in the occupancy calculation.
data_description.motion_timeout: This adds an additional timeout to historical motion sensor data. You can use this to effectively adjust the prior probability for the area and the likelihood of occupancy for any given sensor.
data_description.motion_prob_given_true: The probability that a motion sensor is active when the area is actually occupied. Higher values (closer to 1.0) mean the motion sensor is more reliable when the area is occupied. Default: 0.95 (95%).
data_description.motion_prob_given_false: The probability that a motion sensor is active when the area is not occupied (false positive rate). Lower values (closer to 0.0) mean fewer false positives. Default: 0.005 (0.5%).

windows_and_doors.name: Windows, Doors & Covers
windows_and_doors.description: Configure door, window, and cover sensors and their states

data_description.door_active_state: This is the value your sensors report when the door is closed.
data_description.weight_door: The weight given to door sensor inputs in the occupancy calculation.
data_description.window_active_state: This is the state of the window that will be used to detect occupancy.
data_description.weight_window: The weight given to window sensor inputs in the occupancy calculation.
data_description.cover_sensors: Cover entities (blinds, shades, garage doors, shutters) that indicate occupancy when their state changes.
data_description.cover_active_states: The states of the covers that indicate occupancy (e.g., open, opening, closing).
data_description.weight_cover: The weight given to cover sensor inputs in the occupancy calculation.

wasp_in_box.name: Wasp in Box
wasp_in_box.description: Configure wasp-in-box behavior for single-entry rooms

data_description.wasp_enabled: Enable wasp-in-box behavior and entity for this area.
data_description.wasp_motion_timeout: How long motion remains valid after detection.
data_description.wasp_weight: The weight given to this sensor in the occupancy calculation.
data_description.wasp_max_duration: Maximum duration that the wasp-in-box stays active after the last detected motion, even if no door opens. This is to end a false positive.
data_description.wasp_verification_delay: The delay after closing the last door before any detected motion is considered as actual occupancy. This gives time for the motion sensor to stop reporting motion. (0 = disabled).

media.name: Media Players
media.description: Configure media players and their states

data_description.media_active_states: These are the states of the media players that will be used to detect occupancy.
data_description.weight_media: The weight given to media player inputs in the occupancy calculation.

data_description.appliance_active_states: These are the states of the appliances that will be used to detect occupancy.
data_description.weight_appliance: The weight given to appliance inputs in the occupancy calculation.

data_description.co2_sensors: Carbon dioxide sensors that detect increased CO2 levels from human respiration, indicating occupancy.
data_description.co_sensors: Carbon monoxide sensors that detect increased CO levels from combustion sources and human activity (cooking, heating), indicating occupancy.
data_description.sound_pressure_sensors: Sound pressure sensors (decibels) that detect noise from human activity, indicating occupancy.
data_description.pressure_sensors: Atmospheric pressure sensors that detect subtle changes from HVAC and human presence, indicating occupancy.
data_description.air_quality_sensors: Air quality index sensors that detect general air quality changes, indicating occupancy.
data_description.voc_sensors: Volatile organic compound sensors that detect chemical signatures of human presence, indicating occupancy.
data_description.pm25_sensors: PM2.5 particulate matter sensors that detect fine particles from human activity, indicating occupancy.
data_description.pm10_sensors: PM10 particulate matter sensors that detect coarse particles from human activity, indicating occupancy.
data_description.weight_environmental: The weight given to environmental sensor inputs in the occupancy calculation.

data_description.power_sensors: Power sensors that measure power consumption (W/kW). When consumption is above baseline levels, it indicates active device usage and potential occupancy.
data_description.weight_power: The weight given to power sensor inputs in the occupancy calculation.

parameters.name: Advanced Parameters
parameters.description: Configure advanced parameters for occupancy detection

data_description.threshold: The probability threshold above which the area is considered occupied.
data_description.decay_enabled: Whether to enable time-based decay of occupancy probability.
data_description.decay_half_life: Time window over which occupancy probability decays by half. Set to 0 to use the purpose-based default value, or enter a value between 10 seconds and 1 hour to override. When set to 0, the system automatically uses the half-life value appropriate for the selected area purpose.
data_description.min_prior_override: The minimum prior probability that will be used regardless of learned patterns. The prior (baseline occupancy probability) will never drop below this value, useful for areas that should always have some baseline occupancy probability. Set to 0.0 to disable (default).

data_description.sleep_start: The time when your sleep schedule begins. Areas with the 'Sleeping' purpose will use their configured decay half-life during this period.
data_description.sleep_end: The time when your sleep schedule ends. Areas with the 'Sleeping' purpose will behave like 'Relaxing' areas outside of sleep hours.

manage_people.title: Manage People
manage_people.description: Configure people for sleep presence detection. Each person needs a Home Assistant person entity and a sleep confidence sensor from the Companion App.

person_action.title: Manage Person
person_action.description: Choose an action for this person.

remove_person.title: Remove Person?
remove_person.description: Are you sure you want to remove this person from sleep tracking?

person_config.title: Configure Person
person_config.description: Configure a person's sleep tracking. The person entity provides home/away state. Sleep sensors can be numeric (e.g., sleep confidence 0-100%) or binary (e.g., in-bed sensor).

data_description.person_entity: Select the Home Assistant person entity. This provides home/not_home state.
data_description.sleep_sensors: Select one or more sleep detection sensors. Supports numeric sensors (e.g., sleep confidence 0-100%) and binary sensors (e.g., in-bed sensor, Sleep Focus). Any active sensor means the person is sleeping.
data_description.sleep_area_id: Select the area where this person sleeps (e.g., bedroom).
data_description.confidence_threshold: Minimum percentage to consider the person as sleeping. Only applies to numeric sensors. Default: 75%.
data_description.device_tracker: Home/away detection with a specific device tracker entity. When set, this is used instead of the person entity's state. Leave empty to use the person entity.
